sentences.english: And all things, such as how the affairs on the carrier.
sentences.chinese: 俯觀萬物，擾擾焉如江漢之載浮萍。

sentences.english: Like the rootless duckweed , after floating and then joined to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 就像那本無根的浮萍，漂浮之後終歸大海。

sentences.english: I am like the uprooted duckweed playing my life in the mortal life pool .
sentences.chinese: 我如無根的浮萍，在塵世的方塘裏遊戲着人生。

sentences.english: But Xue Pan was as fickle as water-weed which drifts EAST today, west tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 偏那薛蟠本是浮萍心性，今日愛東，明日愛西。

sentences.english: Emerald duckweed floats on the placid surface lf lake.
sentences.chinese: 我又似那平靜湖面上青翠的浮萍。

sentences.english: RESULTS There is a great difference that roll soybean and duckweed compared with various Chinese herb medicines with the cool pharmaceutical nature.
sentences.chinese: 結果大豆卷和浮萍與辛涼解表藥中諸味藥差異較大。

definition: to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
variant of 飄零|飘零[piao1 ling2]
ups and downs (of life etc)/to drift along/to sink and emerge
lit. sinking and floating/to bob up and down on water/ebb and flow/fig. rise and fall/ups and downs of fortune/vicissitudes
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
